title: Poison resistance
data:
**[English]()**

 • [한국어](/wiki/Poison_resistance/ko "Poison resistance/ko")

**Poison resistance** is considered one of the most essential [intrinsics](/wiki/Intrinsic "Intrinsic") in the game. This [resistance](/wiki/Resistance "Resistance") protects against the harmful effects of [poison](/wiki/Poison "Poison"), including [instadeath](/wiki/Instadeath "Instadeath"). For example, a [dart trap](/wiki/Dart_trap "Dart trap") might shoot out a deadly poisoned [dart](/wiki/Dart "Dart").

Poison resistance does not protect you from [food poisoning](/wiki/Sickness "Sickness"). It only partly protects you from the bad effects of [potion of sickness](/wiki/Potion_of_sickness "Potion of sickness").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Sources](#Sources)

  - [1.1 Safe corpses](#Safe_corpses)
  - [1.2 Unsafe corpses](#Unsafe_corpses)
  - [1.3 Very unsafe corpses](#Very_unsafe_corpses)

- [2 Messages](#Messages)

- [3 External links](#External_links)

- [4 References](#References)

## Sources

Many corpses that offer poison resistance are themselves poisonous or otherwise dangerous (notable exceptions are the corpses of [shriekers](/wiki/Shrieker "Shrieker"), which can usually be found early). There are, however, many safe ways of acquiring poison resistance. For example, [rings](/wiki/Ring_of_poison_resistance "Ring of poison resistance") and [amulets](/wiki/Amulet_versus_poison "Amulet versus poison") both include one that protects you against poison. [Green dragon scale mail](/wiki/Green_dragon_scale_mail "Green dragon scale mail") also protects against poison.

[Barbarians](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian"), [healers](/wiki/Healer "Healer") and [orcs](/wiki/Orc_\(starting_race\) "Orc (starting race)") have a natural poison resistance. [Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk") get a natural poison resistance when they reach [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") 3 and [tourists](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist") at level 20. Poison resistance is also granted when you are [crowned](/wiki/Crowning "Crowning").

You can safely obtain poison resistance from a corpse in one of the following ways:

- Eat a non-poisonous corpse that grants the intrinsic.
- Use a [tinning kit](/wiki/Tinning_kit "Tinning kit") to make a poisonous corpse safe (bear in mind that not all poisonous monsters grant poison resistance).
- Wear an item that grants poison resistance. This could be a [ring of poison resistance](/wiki/Ring_of_poison_resistance "Ring of poison resistance"), an [amulet versus poison](/wiki/Amulet_versus_poison "Amulet versus poison"), an [alchemy smock](/wiki/Alchemy_smock "Alchemy smock"), or [green dragon scale mail](/wiki/Green_dragon_scale_mail "Green dragon scale mail") or [scales](/wiki/Green_dragon_scales "Green dragon scales").
- Use a [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn") to negate the strength drain caused by eating a poisonous corpse (this works because unlike poison attacks, corpse poison cannot cause instadeath, although it causes some HP loss).
- Wear a [ring of sustain ability](/wiki/Ring_of_sustain_ability "Ring of sustain ability") to avoid the strength drain from eating a poisonous corpse.
- If you know you can pray and you have lost more than 4 strength, pick up junk to be overtaxed, and pray to reverse the strength loss after eating poisonous corpses.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Unicorn horns can no longer restore strength, so this tactic is not recommended unless you can cast the [restore ability spell](/wiki/Spellbook_of_restore_ability "Spellbook of restore ability") or don't mind using [prayer](/wiki/Prayer "Prayer").

### Safe corpses

The following corpses provide a chance of gaining poison resistance, and are not dangerous to eat:

| Monster                                                                            | Conduct | Difficulty | Chance |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ---------- | ------ |
| [red mold](/wiki/Red_mold "Red mold")                                              | vegan   | 2          | 3%     |
| [brown mold](/wiki/Brown_mold "Brown mold")                                        | vegan   | 2          | 3%     |
| [cave spider](/wiki/Cave_spider "Cave spider")                                     | meaty   | 3          | 7%     |
| [red naga hatchling](/wiki/Red_naga_hatchling "Red naga hatchling")                | meaty   | 4          | 10%    |
| [flesh golem](/wiki/Flesh_golem "Flesh golem")                                     | meaty   | 10         | 12%    |
| [centipede](/wiki/Centipede "Centipede")                                           | meaty   | 4          | 13%    |
| [blue jelly](/wiki/Blue_jelly "Blue jelly")                                        | vegan   | 5          | 13%    |
| [shrieker](/wiki/Shrieker "Shrieker")                                              | vegan   | 2          | 20%    |
| [golden naga hatchling](/wiki/Golden_naga_hatchling "Golden naga hatchling")       | meaty   | 4          | 20%    |
| [guardian naga hatchling](/wiki/Guardian_naga_hatchling "Guardian naga hatchling") | meaty   | 4          | 20%    |
| [quasit](/wiki/Quasit "Quasit")                                                    | meaty   | 7          | 20%    |
| [pyrolisk](/wiki/Pyrolisk "Pyrolisk")                                              | meaty   | 8          | 20%    |
| [red naga](/wiki/Red_naga "Red naga")                                              | meaty   | 8          | 20%    |
| [black unicorn](/wiki/Black_unicorn "Black unicorn")                               | meaty   | 6          | 27%    |
| [gray unicorn](/wiki/Gray_unicorn "Gray unicorn")                                  | meaty   | 6          | 27%    |
| [white unicorn](/wiki/White_unicorn "White unicorn")                               | meaty   | 6          | 27%    |
| [quivering blob](/wiki/Quivering_blob "Quivering blob")                            | vegan   | 6          | 33%    |
| [golden naga](/wiki/Golden_naga "Golden naga")                                     | meaty   | 13         | 67%    |

### Unsafe corpses

The following corpses and globs are among those that provide poison resistance, but are mildly dangerous:

| Monster                                                                   | Conduct    | Difficulty | Chance | Notes                                                                                            |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------- | ---------- | ------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| [yellow mold](/wiki/Yellow_mold "Yellow mold")                            | vegan      | 2          | 7%     | poisonous and hallucinogenic                                                                     |
| [homunculus](/wiki/Homunculus "Homunculus")                               | meaty      | 3          | 7%     | poisonous                                                                                        |
| [gray ooze](/wiki/Gray_ooze "Gray ooze")                                  | vegetarian | 4          | 7%     | acidic                                                                                           |
| [brown pudding](/wiki/Brown_pudding "Brown pudding")                      | vegetarian | 6          | 7%     | acidic                                                                                           |
| [black pudding](/wiki/Black_pudding "Black pudding")                      | meaty      | 12         | 7%     | acidic                                                                                           |
| [tengu](/wiki/Tengu "Tengu")                                              | meaty      | 7          | 13%    | may also confer [teleportitis](/wiki/Teleportitis "Teleportitis")                                |
| [Chromatic Dragon](/wiki/Chromatic_Dragon "Chromatic Dragon")             | meaty      | 23         | 17%    | poisonous, Caveman [quest nemesis](/wiki/Quest_nemesis "Quest nemesis")                          |
| [black naga hatchling](/wiki/Black_naga_hatchling "Black naga hatchling") | meaty      | 4          | 20%    | acidic                                                                                           |
| [violet fungus](/wiki/Violet_fungus "Violet fungus")                      | vegan      | 5          | 20%    | [hallucinogenic](/wiki/Hallucination "Hallucination")                                            |
| [jellyfish](/wiki/Jellyfish "Jellyfish")                                  | meaty      | 5          | 20%    | poisonous                                                                                        |
| [soldier ant](/wiki/Soldier_ant "Soldier ant")                            | meaty      | 6          | 20%    | poisonous                                                                                        |
| [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor")             | meaty      | 34         | 25%    | [cannibalism](/wiki/Cannibalism "Cannibalism") for humans                                        |
| [snake](/wiki/Snake "Snake")                                              | meaty      | 6          | 27%    | poisonous                                                                                        |
| [water moccasin](/wiki/Water_moccasin "Water moccasin")                   | meaty      | 7          | 27%    | poisonous                                                                                        |
| [killer bee](/wiki/Killer_bee "Killer bee")                               | meaty      | 5          | 30%    | poisonous                                                                                        |
| [giant beetle](/wiki/Giant_beetle "Giant beetle")                         | meaty      | 6          | 33%    | poisonous                                                                                        |
| [giant spider](/wiki/Giant_spider "Giant spider")                         | meaty      | 7          | 33%    | poisonous                                                                                        |
| [gremlin](/wiki/Gremlin "Gremlin")                                        | meaty      | 8          | 33%    | poisonous                                                                                        |
| [pit viper](/wiki/Pit_viper "Pit viper")                                  | meaty      | 9          | 40%    | poisonous                                                                                        |
| [cobra](/wiki/Cobra "Cobra")                                              | meaty      | 10         | 40%    | poisonous                                                                                        |
| [xan](/wiki/Xan "Xan")                                                    | meaty      | 9          | 47%    | poisonous                                                                                        |
| [scorpion](/wiki/Scorpion "Scorpion")                                     | meaty      | 8          | 50%    | poisonous                                                                                        |
| [black naga](/wiki/Black_naga "Black naga")                               | meaty      | 10         | 53%    | acidic                                                                                           |
| [queen bee](/wiki/Queen_bee "Queen bee")                                  | meaty      | 12         | 60%    | poisonous                                                                                        |
| [nurse](/wiki/Nurse "Nurse")                                              | meaty      | 13         | 73%    | cannibalism for humans, bugged in pre-[3.6.2](/wiki/3.6.2 "3.6.2") versions[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) |
| [guardian naga](/wiki/Guardian_naga "Guardian naga")                      | meaty      | 16         | 80%    | poisonous                                                                                        |
| [Scorpius](/wiki/Scorpius "Scorpius")                                     | meaty      | 17         | 100%   | poisonous, Ranger quest nemesis                                                                  |
| [green dragon](/wiki/Green_dragon "Green dragon")                         | meaty      | 20         | 100%   | poisonous                                                                                        |
| [Master Kaen](/wiki/Master_Kaen "Master Kaen")                            | meaty      | 31         | 100%   | cannibalism for humans, Monk quest nemesis                                                       |

### Very unsafe corpses

Unless you are polymorphed into a stoning-resistant form, eating any of these corpses will **instantly** result in [YASD](/wiki/YASD "YASD"). If, however, you are in a stoning-resistant form before getting poison resistance, these corpses can provide it permanently. Note that tinning them does **not** make them safe to eat.

| Monster                                        | Conduct | Difficulty | Chance | Note                                                                                                                    |
| ---------------------------------------------- | ------- | ---------- | ------ | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [chickatrice](/wiki/Chickatrice "Chickatrice") | meaty   | 7          | 27%    | [petrifies](/index.php?title=Petrifies\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Petrifies (page does not exist)") when touched or eaten |
| [cockatrice](/wiki/Cockatrice "Cockatrice")    | meaty   | 8          | 33%    | petrifies when touched or eaten                                                                                         |
| [Medusa](/wiki/Medusa "Medusa")                | meaty   | 25         | 100%   | petrifies when eaten                                                                                                    |

## Messages

- You feel healthy.

  You received poison resistance by eating an applicable corpse or tin, or by reaching level 3 as a Monk; an exclamation point is present in the last case.

- You feel especially healthy.

  As above, while having extrinsic poison resistance (from a ring, amulet, etc.) or poison resistance from level gain.

- You feel hardy!

  You received poison resistance by reaching level 20 as a Tourist.

- You feel a little sick!

  You lost poison resistance due to a gremlin attack at night or eating a [disenchanter](/wiki/Disenchanter "Disenchanter") corpse.

- You feel less healthy/hardy!

  You lost poison resistance due to level drain as a Monk or Tourist.

- You seem unaffected by the poison.

  You ate a poisonous corpse, but suffered minimal damage due to poison resistance.

- The poison doesn't seem to affect you.

  You were hit with a poisonous attack or poisoned weapon, but suffered no additional effects due to poison resistance.

## External links

- [Eating Corpses For Food And Intrinsics](http://web.archive.org/web/20071018034842/http://www.geocities.com/dcorbett42/nethack/corpse.htm)

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [Closed Issue #159: Nurse meat has the flag for conferring poison resistance, but doesn't.](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/issues/159)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.1. Click here for more information.](/images/d/d3/Nh361-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.1. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.6.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.1 "NetHack 3.6.1"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-361}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
Poison resistance

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 한국어

Poison resistance is considered one of the most essential intrinsics in the game. This resistance protects against the harmful effects of poison, including instadeath. For example, a dart trap might shoot out a deadly poisoned dart.

Poison resistance does not protect you from food poisoning. It only partly protects you from the bad effects of potion of sickness.

Contents

  • 1 Sources
    • 1.1 Safe corpses
    • 1.2 Unsafe corpses
    • 1.3 Very unsafe corpses
  • 2 Messages
  • 3 External links
  • 4 References

Sources

Many corpses that offer poison resistance are themselves poisonous or otherwise dangerous (notable exceptions are the corpses of shriekers, which can usually be found early). There are, however, many safe ways of acquiring poison resistance. For example, rings and amulets both include one that protects you against poison. Green dragon scale mail also protects against poison.

Barbarians, healers and orcs have a natural poison resistance. Monks get a natural poison resistance when they reach experience level 3 and tourists at level 20. Poison resistance is also granted when you are crowned.

You can safely obtain poison resistance from a corpse in one of the following ways:

  • Eat a non-poisonous corpse that grants the intrinsic.
  • Use a tinning kit to make a poisonous corpse safe (bear in mind that not all poisonous monsters grant poison resistance).
  • Wear an item that grants poison resistance. This could be a ring of poison resistance, an amulet versus poison, an alchemy smock, or green dragon scale mail or scales.
  • Use a unicorn horn to negate the strength drain caused by eating a poisonous corpse (this works because unlike poison attacks, corpse poison cannot cause instadeath, although it causes some HP loss).
  • Wear a ring of sustain ability to avoid the strength drain from eating a poisonous corpse.
  • If you know you can pray and you have lost more than 4 strength, pick up junk to be overtaxed, and pray to reverse the strength loss after eating poisonous corpses.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Unicorn horns can no longer restore strength, so this tactic is not recommended unless you can cast the restore ability spell or don't mind using prayer.


Safe corpses

The following corpses provide a chance of gaining poison resistance, and are not dangerous to eat:

Monster Conduct Difficulty Chance
red mold vegan 2 3%
brown mold vegan 2 3%
cave spider meaty 3 7%
red naga hatchling meaty 4 10%
flesh golem meaty 10 12%
centipede meaty 4 13%
blue jelly vegan 5 13%
shrieker vegan 2 20%
golden naga hatchling meaty 4 20%
guardian naga hatchling meaty 4 20%
quasit meaty 7 20%
pyrolisk meaty 8 20%
red naga meaty 8 20%
black unicorn meaty 6 27%
gray unicorn meaty 6 27%
white unicorn meaty 6 27%
quivering blob vegan 6 33%
golden naga meaty 13 67%

Unsafe corpses

The following corpses and globs are among those that provide poison resistance, but are mildly dangerous:

Monster Conduct Difficulty Chance Notes
yellow mold vegan 2 7% poisonous and hallucinogenic
homunculus meaty 3 7% poisonous
gray ooze vegetarian 4 7% acidic
brown pudding vegetarian 6 7% acidic
black pudding meaty 12 7% acidic
tengu meaty 7 13% may also confer teleportitis
Chromatic Dragon meaty 23 17% poisonous, Caveman quest nemesis
black naga hatchling meaty 4 20% acidic
violet fungus vegan 5 20% hallucinogenic
jellyfish meaty 5 20% poisonous
soldier ant meaty 6 20% poisonous
Wizard of Yendor meaty 34 25% cannibalism for humans
snake meaty 6 27% poisonous
water moccasin meaty 7 27% poisonous
killer bee meaty 5 30% poisonous
giant beetle meaty 6 33% poisonous
giant spider meaty 7 33% poisonous
gremlin meaty 8 33% poisonous
pit viper meaty 9 40% poisonous
cobra meaty 10 40% poisonous
xan meaty 9 47% poisonous
scorpion meaty 8 50% poisonous
black naga meaty 10 53% acidic
queen bee meaty 12 60% poisonous
nurse meaty 13 73% cannibalism for humans, bugged in pre-3.6.2 versions[1]
guardian naga meaty 16 80% poisonous
Scorpius meaty 17 100% poisonous, Ranger quest nemesis
green dragon meaty 20 100% poisonous
Master Kaen meaty 31 100% cannibalism for humans, Monk quest nemesis

Very unsafe corpses

Unless you are polymorphed into a stoning-resistant form, eating any of these corpses will instantly result in YASD. If, however, you are in a stoning-resistant form before getting poison resistance, these corpses can provide it permanently. Note that tinning them does not make them safe to eat.

Monster Conduct Difficulty Chance Note
chickatrice meaty 7 27% petrifies when touched or eaten
cockatrice meaty 8 33% petrifies when touched or eaten
Medusa meaty 25 100% petrifies when eaten

Messages

You feel healthy.
You received poison resistance by eating an applicable corpse or tin, or by reaching level 3 as a Monk; an exclamation point is present in the last case.
You feel especially healthy.
As above, while having extrinsic poison resistance (from a ring, amulet, etc.) or poison resistance from level gain.
You feel hardy!
You received poison resistance by reaching level 20 as a Tourist.
You feel a little sick!
You lost poison resistance due to a gremlin attack at night or eating a disenchanter corpse.
You feel less healthy/hardy!
You lost poison resistance due to level drain as a Monk or Tourist.
You seem unaffected by the poison.
You ate a poisonous corpse, but suffered minimal damage due to poison resistance.
The poison doesn't seem to affect you.
You were hit with a poisonous attack or poisoned weapon, but suffered no additional effects due to poison resistance.

External links

  • Eating Corpses For Food And Intrinsics

References

  1. ↑ Closed Issue #159: Nurse meat has the flag for conferring poison resistance, but doesn't.

{{languages}}
'''Poison resistance''' is considered one of the most essential [[intrinsic]]s in the game. This [[resistance]] protects against the harmful effects of [[poison]], including [[instadeath]]. For example, a [[dart trap]] might shoot out a deadly poisoned [[dart]].

Poison resistance does not protect you from [[sickness|food poisoning]]. It only partly protects you from the bad effects of [[potion of sickness]].

==Sources==
Many corpses that offer poison resistance are themselves poisonous or otherwise dangerous (notable exceptions are the corpses of [[shrieker]]s, which can usually be found early). There are, however, many safe ways of acquiring poison resistance. For example, [[ring of poison resistance|rings]] and [[amulet versus poison|amulets]] both include one that protects you against poison. [[Green dragon scale mail]] also protects against poison.

[[Barbarian]]s, [[healer]]s and [[orc (starting race)|orc]]s have a natural poison resistance. [[Monk]]s get a natural poison resistance when they reach [[experience level]] 3 and [[tourist]]s at level 20. Poison resistance is also granted when you are [[crowning|crowned]].

You can safely obtain poison resistance from a corpse in one of the following ways:

* Eat a non-poisonous corpse that grants the intrinsic.
* Use a [[tinning kit]] to make a poisonous corpse safe (bear in mind that not all poisonous monsters grant poison resistance).
* Wear an item that grants poison resistance. This could be a [[ring of poison resistance]], an [[amulet versus poison]], an [[alchemy smock]], or [[green dragon scale mail]] or [[green dragon scales|scales]].
* Use a [[unicorn horn]] to negate the strength drain caused by eating a poisonous corpse (this works because unlike poison attacks, corpse poison cannot cause instadeath, although it causes some HP loss).
* Wear a [[ring of sustain ability]] to avoid the strength drain from eating a poisonous corpse.
* If you know you can pray and you have lost more than 4 strength, pick up junk to be overtaxed, and pray to reverse the strength loss after eating poisonous corpses.

{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|Unicorn horns can no longer restore strength, so this tactic is not recommended unless you can cast the [[Spellbook of restore ability|restore ability spell]] or don't mind using [[prayer]].}}

===Very unsafe corpses===
Unless you are polymorphed into a stoning-resistant form, eating any of these corpses will '''instantly''' result in [[YASD]]. If, however, you are in a stoning-resistant form before getting poison resistance, these corpses can provide it permanently. Note that tinning them does '''not''' make them safe to eat.

{|class="prettytable sortable striped"
!Monster         !! Conduct !!                           Difficulty !!                           Chance !! Note
|-
|[[chickatrice]] || meaty   || style="text-align:right" |         7 || style="text-align:right" |   27% || [[petrifies]] when touched or eaten
|-
|[[cockatrice]]  || meaty   || style="text-align:right" |         8 || style="text-align:right" |   33% || petrifies when touched or eaten
|-
|[[Medusa]]      || meaty   || style="text-align:right" |        25 || style="text-align:right" |  100% || petrifies when eaten
|}

==Messages==
{{message|You feel healthy.|You received poison resistance by eating an applicable corpse or tin, or by reaching level 3 as a Monk; an exclamation point is present in the last case.}}
{{message|You feel especially healthy.|As above, while having extrinsic poison resistance (from a ring, amulet, etc.) or poison resistance from level gain.}}
{{message|You feel hardy!|You received poison resistance by reaching level 20 as a Tourist.}}
{{message|You feel a little sick!|You lost poison resistance due to a gremlin attack at night or eating a [[disenchanter]] corpse.}}
{{message|You feel less healthy/hardy!|You lost poison resistance due to level drain as a Monk or Tourist.}}
{{message|You seem unaffected by the poison.|You ate a poisonous corpse, but suffered minimal damage due to poison resistance.}}
{{message|The poison doesn't seem to affect you.|You were hit with a poisonous attack or poisoned weapon, but suffered no additional effects due to poison resistance.}}
